i18n.oblique.http.error.general: An unknown error has occurred. Please try again later.
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.0: The server cannot handle the request (because it is overloaded or down for maintenance). Generally, this is a temporary state.
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.400: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, size too large, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.404: The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future. Subsequent requests by the client are permissible.
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.500: A generic error message, given when an unexpected condition was encountered and no more specific message is suitable.
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.501: The server either does not recognize the request method, or it lacks the ability to fulfil the request. Usually this implies future availability (e.g., a new feature of a web-service API).
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.502: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and received an invalid response from the upstream server.
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.503: The server cannot handle the request (because it is overloaded or down for maintenance). Generally, this is a temporary state.
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.504: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and did not receive a timely response from the upstream server.
i18n.oblique.http.error.timeout: The server is taking too long to respond. Please try again later or contact the support.
